Code source de utils.logger

"""This module contains the logger class and its configurations."""

import logging



[docs]class LoggerConfigurations:
    """Configuration for the logger."""


[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_logger(name=__name__):
        """Return a logger instance for the given name."""
        logger = logging.getLogger(name)
        logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)

        # Common formatter
        formatter = logging.Formatter(
            '%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')

        # Debug handler
        debug_file_handler = logging.FileHandler('logs/debug.log')
        debug_file_handler.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
        debug_file_handler.setFormatter(formatter)
        logger.addHandler(debug_file_handler)

        # Error handler
        error_file_handler = logging.FileHandler('logs/error.log')
        error_file_handler.setLevel(logging.ERROR)
        error_file_handler.setFormatter(formatter)
        logger.addHandler(error_file_handler)

        # Console handler for errors
        console_handler = logging.StreamHandler()
        console_handler.setLevel(logging.ERROR)
        console_handler.setFormatter(formatter)
        logger.addHandler(console_handler)

        return logger




[docs]class Logger:
    """Class to log different levels of logs."""

    def __init__(self, name=__name__):
        """Initialize the logger with a specific name."""
        self.logger = LoggerConfigurations.get_logger(name)


[docs]    def log_error(self, msg):
        """Log an error message."""
        self.logger.error(msg)



[docs]    def log_debug(self, msg):
        """Log a debug message."""
        self.logger.debug(msg)



[docs]    def log_critical(self, msg):
        """Log a critical message."""
        self.logger.critical(msg)
